documentation.synopsis: The pEstim process aim is to provide an estimate of the robot's speed from the inputs given to the thrusters, by integrating the dynamic model. For this purpose, a MODEL IDENTIFICATION MUST have been performed. The model identification must identify the DAMPING MATRIX, i.e. ~the damping coefficients in every direction, the COEFF MATRIX, which maps Forces applied by the thrusters (in Newton) to Inputs sent to the thrusters (adimensional between [-1,1]), assuming a linear relationship. The MASS will have been identified too. The process doesn't start publishing/estimating untill the MISSION_STARTED signal has been received.

moosvar.varinfo: [-1,1], left thruster input. We want to retrieve the force it generates this input.
[-1,1], right thruster input. We want to retrieve the force it generates this input.
[-1,1], vertical thruster input. We want to retrieve the force it generates this input.
false => we use GPS, true => we cut GPS and integrate motion model
GPS Easting, in meter, positive towards east
GPS Northing, in meter, positive towards north
Keller depth, positive towards the center of earth
Position integrated using the equations of motions and the thrusters inputs. Z is positive towards UP direction.
Speed of the robot, expressed in its LOCAL frame. X on the antero-posterior axis pointing FORWARD, Y on the transversal axis pointing LEFT, Z pointing UP
Speed of the robot, expressed in the GLOBAL frame, is simply the transformation of SPEED_LOCAL_DEAD_RECKONING using the IMU_YAW angle from the INS

documentation.optional-comments: If no identification of MASS, DAMPING, and COEFF_MATRIX have been made, don't use this, better of using the accelerometers.
